INSTALL_MSG:
Done.

Note that I've recieved a LOT of questions about why the cog doesn't log things to a channel. **This cog does post activity in a channel!** Rather, it records activity __to disk__, in the `data/activitylogger/` folder.

If you wanted something that posts activity to a channel, you should use Paddo's grenzpolizei cog instead: <http://cogs.red/cogs/PaddoInWonderland/PaddoCogs/grenzpolizei/>

For more information on activitylog, see: <https://github.com/calebj/calebj-cogs#what-does-activitylog-do>.
NAME: Activity Logger
SHORT: Logger for server and direct messages, attachments, and server changes.
DESCRIPTION:
Activitylog has the ability to log the following:
Direct and server messages, with attachments, delete and edit
Member changes: nickname, username, roles, join/leave, ban, kick
Server changes: name, region, owner, icon
Channel changes: create, delete, name, position, topic
Role changes: create, delete, permissions, name, color, hoist, mentionable, position
